articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! As is customary, I must jam my new cat into every article. I’ve tried to offer her several books, but she’s failed to turn even a single page so far. What a big dumbo. The best dumbo. The sweetest, smartest dumbo in the world, yes she is. Ahem. This week, it’s Supermassive, Niantic, and Sensible Object narrative designer and Limit Break mentor, Anastasia Dukakis! Cheers Ana! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Supermassive and Niantic narrative designer Anastasia Dukakis

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for more cat. She’s flop and headbutt-level comfortable around me now, but she still seems a bit terrified of my house in general. I’m going to hang out with her a bunch and see if I can instill some sort of object permanence re: my presence in the home. Before that, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Stranger Video is a website that wants access to your webcam. Grant it and it will show you a close-up of your own face, the background around you cropped out. Close your eyes to tell it you're ready, and open them again when you hear a chime. It'll now connect you to a stranger doing the same thing: first person to blink loses.

You can play it here.

 
Read more
articles.title: Let's have a staring contest

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Valve have their own rating system for measuring how games run on Steam Deck, but even following the guidance of whether something is "Playable" or "Verified", I've still run into games that simply do not work on the handheld device.

Enter Steam reviews. Reviews from players who primarily played on Steam Deck will now have a little Deck icon, which when moused over tells you the exact amount of time spent on the Deck.

 
Read more
articles.title: You can now filter Steam reviews to show those who "played mostly on Steam Deck"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Tens of thousands of people have been playing Deadlock, a new multiplayer shooter from Valve, for the past several months, but in that time there's been no official announcement or acknowledgement of the game's existence by its creators. Until now. Valve have posted an extremely barebones Steam store page for Deadlock, describing it as a "multiplayer game in early development."

 
Read more
articles.title: Deadlock, Valve's new multiplayer shooter, now has a barebones Steam page

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Hello hello hello! This is Edwin chatting. I don't usually get to do these weekend features, but Ollie and James are busy working their magic (stripmining Black Myth: Wukong for guides and fleeing Gamescom), while Nic can't type complete words anymore without getting his hands eaten (see latest domestic update, below). I know that Ollie usually does a picture puzzle for you, but I am comparatively innocent in the ways of Photoshop and more importantly, very lazy - so lazy that I can't think of an elegant way to complete this paragraph, and will proceed immediately to stating: here's what we're all playing this weekend.
 
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you like jumping on enveloping pixelly architecture while basking in an atmosphere of pathological sadness, set aside some time on 20th September, because that’s when Rubeki's first-person spelunker Lorn’s Lure launches on Steam. Ah, I've been waiting a while for this one. Catch a new trailer below.
 Read more
articles.title: Amazingly grim retro sci-fi android spelunker Lorn’s Lure finally has a release date

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Everything I know about the French Revolution has hitherto come from two literary works: Hilary Mantel's excellent doorstopper A Place Of Greater Safety, and Kate Beaton's webcomics. Neither Mantel nor Beaton mention mechs, which are a core feature of Studio Imugi's new "ideology driven" turn-based strategy game Bonaparte: A Mechanized Revolution. I, for one, feel like I've been grossly ill-informed. Kate, Hilary - I've been quoting you for years at parties and it seems like all this time, people have been silently judging me for my ignorance of the role giant clockwork soldiers played in the fall of the Bastille.
 Read more
articles.title: Turn-based strategy game Bonaparte wants to redo the French Revolution, but this time with mechs

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
"Age of Empires with dinosaurs" is, the developers of the Dinolords recently told me in a cramped Gamescom booth, a flattering description for their upcoming England vs. Vikingsaurus RTS. It’s also not a terribly accurate one. From what I saw of the game, Dinolords is more about the lords than the dinos, having as much in common with Diablo-style ARPGs as it does with classic strategy. And that’s a distinction which might just elevate it out of novelty status.
Read more
articles.title: T-Rexes aren’t the only twist that Dinolords puts on medieval strategy

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Take the ballroom scene from Disney's Beauty And The Beast, swap the wailing utensils for an army of chibi cats, endow Belle with low-key Doctor Manhattan-grade powers of matter transformation, and you're perhaps beginning to approximate the experience of Infinity Nikki - an open world dress-up adventure from Singapore-based Infold and former Legend of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild developer Kentaro Tominaga.
Trailered this week at Gamescom 2024, it's the fifth installment in the hitherto mobile-focussed Nikki series and it's seemingly going down a storm, with over 12 million pre-registrations so far (albeit, many of them motivated by the prospect of collectively unlocked in-game bonuses). It's also a free-to-play game, and I have the usual unanswered questions about currencies and gacha, but I'm willing to give it the benefit of the doubt for the minute, because I have not spent nearly enough of my life considering the tactical applications of ballgowns. Here's that trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Glamtime never ends in Infinity Nikki, the open world dress-up game from Zelda talent

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
A few months back, I enjoyed lurking a conversation on the RPS Discord about the proliferation of cyberpunk/steampunk/atompunk/what-have-you-punk variants and how most of them in fact lack the rebelliousness and counter-counter elements that punk actually entails. That discussion was back on my mind as I sat down to play Reignbreaker, a new action-roguelike from Studio Fizbin, at Gamescom 2024 – slightly wary of its self-described medievalpunk styling. However! Turns out you’re trying to kill the queen. Yep, that’s, uh, that’s pretty punk.
Read more
articles.title: Reignbreaker is an anti-establishment roguelike that’s clearly pro-Hades

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I can guarantee you that a zombie survival game called God Save Birmingham wasn't on your "2024 Video Game Announcements" bingo card. It takes place in 14th century England, and tasks you with fending off the rampant zombie hordes of a populace who've succumbed to a mysterious case of reanimation. Perhaps the cause is that there's no Maccies or TK Maxx at the local Bull Ring yet.
Read more
articles.title: Here's an open world zombie survival game set in medieval.... Birmingham?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’m still a little giddy over how much I enjoyed lucarne-lobbing puzzler Tactical Breach Wizards. So much so that I mentioned in my review how I’m well up for another run of its fifteen hour campaign. I’d already got a few missions into hard mode. There's no more starting mana points! It’s a real...pane.
Now, I might have to start again, even if going out of my way to grab the tapes added in its developer's commentary mode is going to be extra tricky. Ah, but will being able to chuck the recorders at my enemies for a point of knockback afterwards make up for it?
 
Read more
articles.title: Even Tactical Breach Wizards' developer commentary can be used to knock people out of windows

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Earlier this year, Bungie's 1990s sci-fi shooter, Marathon, came to Steam for free. And Marathon 2 followed in July. But this series is a trilogy. Where's the third one? I want the thir-- oh, it's here now. Yesterday, the final game, Marathon Infinity trickled onto the storefront, offering a neat little bundle for fans of retro shooters. But it's also a reminder that we've yet to see more of Bungie's upcoming reboot.
Read more
articles.title: The full original Marathon trilogy is now free on Steam, but Bungie are still quiet on the reboot

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
One of my formative video game moments is the final mission of Psygnosis cyberpunk flight sim G-Police. (It came out in 1997, and as such, I think the statute of limitations on spoilers has passed, but if you still intend to play, stop reading now.) The mission completes the long arc of foreshadowing begun by the intro's mention that capital-class spacecraft have been outlawed, following a ruinous war. It turns out that one particular evil corpo has been sneakily building one of these megaships - not only that, but you get to fly inside it, cannons ablazing. It was while doing so that teenage me realised the true exceptionality of the Video Game Artform. You can't fly inside capital ships in, like, symbolist poems or baroque symphonies, can you? You can't fly in poems or symphonies at all, unless you do so metaphorically - "metaphor" being a kind of poor man's graphics card.
The technology of flight simming has advanced mightily since G-Police's day. For instance: in Everspace 2's just-announced Titans DLC, you get to fly inside not just regular old spaceships, but massive space kaiju with procedurally generated digestive systems. Here's the trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Everspace 2 turns Monster Hunter with secret nebula-dwelling kaiju that are essentially living procgen dungeons

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Assassin's Creed: Valhalla, Odyssey, and Origins all have one thing in common: they've got a Discovery mode, which replaces murdering with learning. You can, quite literally, go on tours curated by historians around each of the game's respective maps. Instead of diving off a Sphinx and plunging your hidden blade into someone's spinal column, you can look up at the Sphinx and read a paragraph on its significance. Maybe view an actual, real life bit of ancient Egypt from an actual real life museum collection in-game. Perhaps embody an Anglo-Saxon lad in Valhalla, instead, and like, cook up some nettle soup having just got a fresh "Friar Tuck" at the local hair choppers (no guarantees on this last bit).
This is all to say that Black Myth: Wukong deserves such a mode, too. There were so many times throughout my review time where I stopped and stared and wondered as to something's meaning. Not only in the architecture, but in the characters, too. So here I am with a proposition: how about instead of thwacking things with my staff, I can use it as a walking stick and point it at things I want to learn about.
Read more
articles.title: Black Myth: Wukong needs an Assassin's Creed-style discovery mode

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We haven't written about Diplomacy Is Not An Option since it launched in Early Access in 2022, when it was a light and frothy strategy game about smashing thousands of peasants to bits with physics magic. It's still that, but now it's getting a 1.0 release on October 4th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Diplomacy Is Not An Option's castle-building spectacle-strategy gets a 1.0 release October 4th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We've been distracted by Gamescom, several game releases, the rapid dwindling of the British summer. Or I assume we have, for why else would we not have yet posted about the Steam Rhythm Fest, which began on Monday and runs until August 26th at 10am PT/6pm BRDST*.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam Rhythm Fest is underway with discounts and demos for games with a good beat

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I recently wrote about a game that aimed to recreate the old magic of Tokyo Xtreme Racer, a series of late-night, urban racing games that hadn't had a new (non-mobile) entry in 18 years. Oh, what a neglected niche those indie developers were filling!

Yeah, a new Tokyo Xtreme Racer was just announced from original developers Genki, and it's targeting a Steam release next year.

 
Read more
articles.title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer is returning after 18 years, with a new game coming to Steam next year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Ubisoft have announced Heroes of Might & Magic: Olden Era, a fresh instalment in the exceedingly olden turn-based strategy RPG series, which began life under New World Computing in 1995. The new game will “return to the world of Enroth and the origins of the legendary saga”, inviting “both veterans and new players” to go on a quest to Jadame, “a mysterious continent in turmoil”. Expect new factions, biomes and creatures, together with such M&M standbys as castle management, army clashes, hex-based maps, and, who knows, maybe some heroes.
 Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft announce new back-to-roots Heroes of Might & Magic game with the Iratus devs in charge

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you've been necromantically dreaming of a Callisto Protocol sequel, I'm afraid the monkey paw finger hasn't just curled - it's jammed itself right up your nose and scratched an FU on your hypothalamus. Developers Striking Distance and publishers Krafton have revealed [REDACTED], a scifi roguelike dungeon crawler set in the same universe.
The square brackets are part of the title, yes, and they're also calling it "punk rock" - a combination of factors that fills me with a rage so obliterating, I can barely perceive the announcement trailer, below. It's a machinegun montage of comicbook panels and sizzling melee arcs and quips like "there's a lot of wankers between you and the sweet taste of freedom". I didn't even like The Callisto Protocol that much but still, what have they done to you, boy? Where did all the horror game go?
 Read more
articles.title: The Callisto Protocol series returns as... top-down roguelike geezer shooter [REDACTED]

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It is perhaps deeply ungrateful of me that, when presented with the squirrel with a gun of Squirrel With A Gun, my immediate reaction is to thrust out my bowl like a ballsy victorian urchin and ask for additional squirrel information. It’s not that developer Dee Dee Creations haven’t shown off the game in action. It’s just that I find myself rooting so hard for this not to just be a vapid bit of meme-ware that I’m getting more concerned as we rapidly approach its 29th August release.
Read more
articles.title: I’m rooting for you Squirrel With A Gun, but you still won’t explain yourself

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I shouldn’t be too surprised really. If a park sim based on Tim Burton’s 1996 B-Movie homage Mars Attacks wasn’t on my bingo card, it’s because I’ve recently binned it and replaced it with a bobble head that simply nods in amused acceptance at whatever videogames decide to do next. And conceptually, Jurassic World Evolution with captive humans instead of dinos isn’t not a potential winner, is it? Still, I was mildly bemused to learn that Mars Attracts, coming sometime next year, is the film’s first licensed game. But then I realised that I’d never thought to check before, which might go some way to explaining the lack of them. Do you reckon they did the pun then worked backwards from there? Respectable, honestly.
Read more
articles.title: New theme park manager Mars Attracts is the oddest bit of IP necromancy I’ve seen in quite some time

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Earlier today, old man James wagged a finger at us all sternly for not writing about Atomfall before. My turn to puff out my cheeks and look not angry, just disappointed: why haven't we covered The Stone Of Madness prior to the below Gamescom 2024 story trailer? I mean, it's only a real-time tactical stealth game set in a cursed 18th century Jesuit monastery, developed by the people behind gorgeously gross metroidvania Blasphemous. It's only got isometric art inspired by Goya and a sanity/trauma system redolent of Darkest Dungeon. Sounds like an automatic RPS write-up to me. 
 Read more
articles.title: The Blasphemous dev's new Goya-fuelled stealth tactics monastery sim is basically Umberto Eco's The Great Escape

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Remember that puzzle game Unravel and its star: a cute lad made of yarn called Yarny? He'd tackle headscratchers by unwinding the very fabric of his body, similar to how a human being might feed their intestines through a karabiner and use it as a tether for a spot of rock climbing. Well, some of the minds behind Unravel are working on new game called Hela. This time it's less about yarn and more about being a small mouse who does parkour. Still, it does retain some of the bodily gymnastics of its predecessor. Namely the use of tongues as bungee ropes.
Read more
articles.title: Former Unravel devs announce Scandinavian parkour mouse sim where you can walk on tongues

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
I've yet to discover a SteamWorld game I don't like. Whether plundering the earth in SteamWorld Dig 2 or mucking about with magic in SteamWorld Quest, these are solid and approachable adventures that enthusiastically embrace whatever theme the developers have decided upon. Cowboys? Sure. Wizards? Why not. It barely matters, as long as it results in some good puns. As a studio, Thunderful have a reputation for hopping from one style of game to the next, boiling entire genres down to their essence, and reconstituting them with competence and style to exist within a now-familiar steampunk world of colourful pals and Saturday morning cartoon jokes. The studio is a perpetual notion machine. Yes, with SteamWorld Heist 2, they're revisiting the sci-fi bullet-bouncing of their 2016 tactics game SteamWorld Heist, but they're also introducing significant changes to create a compulsive XCOM-like full of sea-faring submariners that may be their best work yet, even against a back catalogue of blinders. 
Read more
articles.title: SteamWorld Heist 2 review: a tactical trick shot across the bow of lesser strategy games

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you're feeling very rested and at peace today, I do not recommend you play the demo for just-announced puzzle game Wilmot Works It Out. It will relax you so much that you gently petrify. Future archaeologists will marvel at you, a smiling stone figure in the ruins of a bygone civilisation. "What exactly was going on back in 2024 to inspire such a critical intensity of chillax?" they will wonder. Then, they will spot the computer screen glowing beneath its layer of dust, and the cycle will begin anew.
 Read more
articles.title: Wilmot Works It Out is the picture puzzle sequel to the wonderful warehouse sim - here's a demo

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tímto příspěvkem bych chtěl volně navázat na předchozí články zabývající se klasifikací obrázků do několika tříd. V těch dřívějších článcích se jednalo o rozpoznání zápalu plic na základě RTG snímků.
articles.title: Lokalizace infekce malárie: klasifikační model a heatmap

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dnes vynecháme menší dílčí novinky v budoucím vydání jádra Linux 6.12, naopak se podíváme primárně na poslední práce, které na tomto poli odvádí Intel pro své nejnovější grafické jádro generace Xe2.
articles.title: Novinky pro Linux 6.12 s důrazem na Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: K zobrazení textové informace je potřeba písmo. Jeho volba významně ovlivňuje čitelnost textu a má velký dopad na uživatelský zážitek. Pojďme se podívat, jaké máme v písmech možnosti, jak je využívat, co dělat a čemu se naopak vyhnout.
articles.title: Písma a jejich použití: od beden s odlitky ke stažení souborů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ještě jednou se vrátíme k modelu pro lineární regresi. S ním jsme se již setkali, ovšem ve skutečnosti je i zdánlivě jednoduchý koncept lineární regrese realizován tak, že ho lze využít mnoha dalšími způsoby.
articles.title: Scikit-learn: jednoduchý a současně i univerzální model lineární regrese

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Ondřej Surý)
articles.description: Nová verze DNS serveru BIND 9.20.0 přináší významná vylepšení po dvou letech vývoje. Klíčové novinky zahrnují nové aplikační a databázové jádro, optimalizovanou podporu DNSSEC a vylepšenou kompresi DNS jmen.
articles.title: BIND 9.20: vylepšený výkon resolveru a nové databázové a aplikační jádro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se podíváme na SQL klienta, budeme zkoumat elementy testovaných aplikací a nakonec si zaznamenáme čas strávený na projektech.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (4. 9. 2024): mějte své databáze pevně v rukou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Grafické karty EGA a VGA byly postaveny na konceptu takzvaných bitových rovin. To si vyžádalo podporu různých čtecích a zápisových režimů, jež sice komplikovaly programování, ovšem přinesly velmi rychlé přenosy v rámci video RAM.
articles.title: Skrytá síla karty VGA: čtecí a zápisové režimy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: Podíváme se na zneužití chyb v prohlížečích Chrome a Safari, botnetové útoky skrze IP kamery, quishingovou kampaň využívající Microsoft Sway a nové útoky čínské skupiny Volt Typhoon.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: chyby v prohlížečích a nová quishingová kampaň

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: ElasticSearch a Kibana jsou znovu k dispozici pod open-source licencí. Aktualizace od společnosti Microsoft narušila nastavení dualbootu pro uživatele Linuxu na počítačích, kde byl povolen Secure Boot.
articles.title: Aktualizace Microsoftu narušila spouštění Linuxu, Kibana je znovu open source

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Šest týdnů do uvedení Plasmy 6.2, známe poslední novinky, Microsoft vylepšuje D3D12 akceleraci videa v Mesa, VKD3D 1.13 též vylepšuje Direct3D 12 API nad Vulkanem, QR kernel panic postavený na Rustu.
articles.title: Kernel panic s QR v Linuxu 6.12, neshody Rust vývojářů se správci částí jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Minulý týden jsme tu měli projekt internetového rádia Yoradio s ESP32. Poté jsem byl upozorněn na projekt AM/FM rádia, také založeném na ESP32 a čipu TEF6686/TEF6687. Projekt založila skupina kolem FMDX.org. Dokáže přijímat FM OIRT a CCIR 65–108 MHz a také AM dlouhé, střední a krátké vlny 144 kHz – 27 MHz.
articles.title: AM/FM rádio s ESP32

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description:
Server Phoronix testoval server s procesorem AmpereOne A192–32X 
(192 Arm64 jader na 3,2 GHz) na jádře 6.11 s výchozí stránkou 4 kB a 64 kB. Jako téměř všechny Arm64 procesory je výchozí stránka konfigurovatelná a může být 4, 16, nebo 64 kB. Přitom x86 má pouze 4 kB. Větší stránka znamená větší výkon, ale také o trochu větší spotřebu paměti. Google u Androidu chystá přechod z 4 kB na 16 kB a slibuje průměrně o 5–10 % lepší výkon a asi o 9 % větší spotřebu paměti.
articles.title: Test výkonu AmpereOne se stránkou 64 kB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výzkumníci z Virtuals Protocol vytvořili AI MarioVGG (Virtual Game Generation), která dokáže vytvořit video hru jen podle videa, v tomto případě Super Mario Bros.  Dataset s obrázky ze hry je dostupný na GitHubu. Obsahuje přes 700 tisíc obrázků z 280 úrovní hry. Přitom se rozlišují pouze příkazy „běž doprava“ a „běž doprava a skoč“.
articles.title: AI vytvořilo hru Super Mario jen podle videa

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O podpoře GPU Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage Xe2 v linuxovém jádře jsme tu dnes psali. Dostane se do jádra 6.12.
articles.title: Mesa 24.2.2 podporuje Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage Xe2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: HTTPS se stává běžným, většina webů už ho nasadila. Jak to ale udělat správně, opravdu bezpečně a hlavně bezbolestně? Na školení HTTPS pro správce serverů si ukážeme si nejnovější trendy, prakticky si vyzkoušíme vygenerování certifikátu a nasazení na web server.
articles.title: HTTPS pro správce serverů (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jason Donenfeld, vývojář WireGuardu, již dva roky pracuje na getrandom() ve vDSO, aby bylo možné náhodná čísla v user-space generovat rychleji přímo v jádře. Pro architekturu x86_64 bylo getrandom() ve vDSO začleněno do jádro 6.11.
articles.title: Jádro 6.12 bude mít getrandom() ve vDSO pro Arm64 a LongArch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Intel se podělil o několik důležitých novinek týkajících se vyšetřování problému s nestabilitou Vmin Shift u desktopových procesorů Intel Core 13. a 14. generace, o které jsme psali už v srpnu. Výrobce potvrdil, že nová generace procesorů s kódovým označením Arrow Lake a Lunar Lake problémem netrpí.
articles.title: Intel vydal nový seznam procesorů, které nejsou ovlivněny nestabilitou „Vmin Shift“

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojářům operačního systému Redox OS napsaném v jazyce Rust se podařilo vyřešit výkonnostní úzké hrdlo, takže je systém mnohem výkonnější, když běží jako virtuální stroj. V některých syntetických benchmarcích dokonce dokáže běžet „o něco rychleji“ než Linux. Žádná konkrétní čísla ale zveřejněna nebyla.
articles.title: Redox zlepšil výkon ve virtuálním prostředí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili novou verzi virtualizačního nástroje QEMU označenou jako 9.1. Přináší řadu změn v mnoha oblastech, nejdůležitější je ale podpora nových procesorů Intel Icelake-Server-v7, SapphireRapids-v3 a SierraForest a podporu AMD SEV-SNP použitelnou s novými jádry s podporou pro AMD EPYC.
articles.title: Vyšlo QEMU 9.1 s podporou AMD SEV-SNP a akcelerací Intel IAA při migraci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mozilla má zájem o dekodér obrázků JPEG XL napsaný v jazyce Rust kvůli jeho paměťové bezpečnosti. Bobby Holley, technický šéf Firefoxu, vyjádřil svůj postoj k podpoře dekodéru obrázků JPEG XL pro Firefox napsaného v Rustu. Říká v něm, že vývojáři zvažují zařazení nového dekodéru napsaného v Rustu.
articles.title: Mozilla by chtěla dekodér pro JPEG XL napsaný v Rustu, vyvine jej zřejmě Google

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V repozitářích pro aktuální Debian je sice k dispozici více než 74 tisíc balíčků pro architekturu x86_64, ale ne všechny balíčky jsou dobře udržované a část z nich již dlouho nebyla udržována či aktualizována. Vývojáři Debianu nedávno začali diskutovat o tom, jak začít z archivu odstraňovat další z těchto dlouho neudržovaných balíčků.
articles.title: Vývojáři Debianu diskutují o odstranění neudržovaných balíčků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google oznámil, že zdrojový kód systému Android 15 byl uvolněn do projektu Android Open-Source Project (AOSP). Pro telefony Pixel by přitom systém byl měl být vydán během několika následujících týdnů. Ostatní výrobci na svá zařízení dostanou Android 15 v řádu měsíců. Nyní mohou na portaci začít také tvůrci alternativních ROM.
articles.title: Android 15 uvolněn do projektu Android Open-Source

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Pytelka)
articles.description: Tým věnující se projektu Bugzilla připravil po pěti letech novou stabilní verzi 5.2. Současně pokračuje vývoj budoucí verze 6 (projekt Harmony), společně byla vydána verze 5.9.1 - Developer Preview Release.
articles.title: Vyšla Bugzilla 5.2 a 5.91

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený firmware Coreboot v nové verzi 24.08 podporuje tři desítky dalších desek, kde mezi těmi uživatelsky běžně kupovanými najdeme ASRock Fatal1ty Z87 Professional, Z87E-ITX, Z87M OC Formula, Z97E-ITX/ac či Gigabyte GA-H61M-S2P-R3 a notebook HP EliteBook 8560w. Celkově více než 900 patchů od více než 130 vývojářů stojí i za opravou řady chyb.
articles.title: Coreboot 24.08 přidává 31 základních desek a počáteční podporu Intel Panther Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Příslušný Wayland protokol xx-color-management-v4 pro správu barev (color management) je již součástí kandidáta na vydání ostré verze kompozitoru GNOME Mutter 47. Shrnuje řadu pull requestů implementujích podporu pro barevné prostory sRGB a PQ+Bt.2020 (Perceptual Quantize).
articles.title: GNOME Mutter 47 přinese správu barev na Waylandu a opravu EGLDevice pro starší GeForce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zatímco s JPEG XL se Google moc nezabývá, AVIF má u něj stále lépe a lépe ustláno. Po jinak běžně Googlem podporovaném formátu WebP, odvozeném od videa WebM, tedy komprese VP8/VP9, nyní do vyhledávání Googlu nyní přibývá podpora obrázků ve formátu AVIF.
articles.title: Google přidává podporu AVIF do vyhledávání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla objevena zranitelnost v kryptografické knihovně společnosti Infineon, která se používá v zařízeních YubiKey řady 5 a Security Key Series s firmwarem před verzí 5.7.0 a YubiHSM 2 s firmwarem před verzí 2.4.0. Společnost Yubico potvrdila dopad na její bezpečnostní tokeny, závažnost ohodnotila stupněm střední.
articles.title: Chyba v knihovně Infineon ohrožuje soukromé klíče z tokenů YubiKey a dalších zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na školení si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit pomocí nejnovějšího protokolu WireGuard.
articles.title: WireGuard: nasazujeme VPN rychle a jednoduše (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Ač to podle počasí nevypadá, prázdniny skončily. Nesmutněte však, neboť již tento čtvrtek bude Virtuální Bastlírna - setkání elektroniků, bastlířů, ajťáků a všech milovníků techniky! Jaké novinky a témata tam čekají?
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 42: nový mikrokontrolér od Raspberry Pi Foundation

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři Intelu svižně dokončují podporu druhé velké generace svých GPU. Pod názvem Battlemage se snad skutečně objeví plnohodnotné grafické karty, ne jen integrovaná jádra (ač o tom stále kromě neoficiálních zvěstí nemáme informace), nicméně dále vyvíjená podpora v Linuxu a projektech souvisejících naznačuje, že tento projekt Intel k ledu nedal.
articles.title: Podpora pro Intel Battlemage v Linuxu 6.12 a Mesa 24.3 finišuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Mnoho novinek ve Firefoxu 130 věru co do počtu není, ale dvě z nich potěší našince z Česka i Slovenska. Firefox 130 přináší podporu překladů dílčích částí webových stránek, které již samy jako celek byly přeloženy. V překladech ve Firefoxu pak mezi novými 11 jazyky nalezneme i češtinu a slovenštinu. Mozilla zde nijak, na rozdíl od jiných, nesleduje, co si uživatel nechává přeložit.
articles.title: Firefox 130 vylepšuje překlady stránek, nově umí i češtinu a slovenštinu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Rawtherapee 5.11 je už více než týden venku a konečně se z domovského webu projektu dozvídáme soupis novinek. Mezi nimi nechybí například přechod na skutečný HiDPI režim zobrazení (kde je potřeba), nastavitelnou hodnotu maximálního zoomu v editoru, možnost nechat si při prohlížení fotek zobrazit v daném adresáři i jeho podadresáře.
articles.title: Rawtherapee 5.11 přechází na libraw a přináší vylepšení prakticky ve všech nástrojích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Play Store na Androidu byl doposud při aktualizaci více aplikací pomalý. Aktualizoval aplikace po jedné, vždy čekal, až se předchozí aplikace stáhne a nainstaluje.
articles.title: Play Store na Androidu bude nyní aktualizovat až tři aplikace současně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Téměř před rokem se v jádře 6.8 objevil první ovladač napsaný v Rustu. Šlo o síťovou kartu Asix AX88796B. Do jádra 6.12 se chystá další ovladač a je to opět síťová karta.
articles.title: Další síťová karta bude mít jaderný ovladač v Rustu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Žebříčků populárnosti programovacích jazyků existuje spousta. Server ZDNET vytvořil svůj žebříček tak, že dal dohromady výsledky devíti známých indexů. Jsou tu tři Stack Overflow, tři IEEE, PYPL, Tiobe a GitHub.
articles.title: Nejpopulárnější programovací jazyky podle ZDNET: Python, JavaScript a Java

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Odchylky v interakcích částic mají ukazovat na existenci nových bosonů. Předpovídají nový detekovatelný zdroj gravitačních vln z kolabujících hvězd.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Informatici z Matfyzu získali US patent na vícezdrojový překlad

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ness Czech spouští nový inovační datový hub pro střední a východní Evropu. Fortinet rozšiřuje bezpečnostní platformu pro ochranu kyberneticko-fyzikálních systémů. Umělá inteligence předvídá zločin a odhalí i ukrytou zbraň. Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat. Red Hat na podporu svých implementačních partnerů rozšířil partnerský program.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový objev ve světě polovodičů: Vědci potvrdili existenci další modifikace uhlíku. Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Vodu v hlubinách Marsu nepřeceňovat.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Technosignatury se možná dají snadno přehlédnout

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Slevy v akci Back to School pokračují. Jedna ze stránek, která poskytuje nejlepší nabídku a je také spolehlivá, je Goodoffer24.com. Zde jsou ceny které se vymykají, zvláště pro operační systém Microsoft, a to jak pro současnou verzi, tak předchozí, a také jak pro verze Pro či Home. A dále také, s exkluzivním kódem, můžete získat další 30% slevu, abyste se mohli těšit z doživotních licencí. Nebo jinak, platíte jen jednou a můžete zapomenout na problémy.
articles.title: Slevy na Goodoffer24 Back to School až 91 %: Windows 11 jen za €20, Office za €24!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 35/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acronis představuje novou verzi Acronis True Image na českém trhu. Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %. Vědci vyvinuli metodu detekce jednoatomových defektů v polovodičích. Každá pátá firma zasažena útoky na dodavatelský řetězec hardwaru. České firmy platí po útoků ransomwarem výkupné i 6 milionů Kč.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Navrhují hledat temnou hmotu v neutronových hvězdách. Nová analýza dat z Webbova dalekohledu ukazuje, že s Hubbleovou konstantou nemusí být problém.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nitridy uhlíku mohou konkurovat diamantu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 34/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V letních měsících byly vydány aktualizace openSUSE Leap a SUSE, FreeBSD, Debianu, na testování zabezpečení zaměřených distribucí Kali a Parrot, dále např. IPFire, EasyOS, Tails či EndeavourOS.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 23-26/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: AI působí jako katalyzátor ransomwarových útoků, ale i jako jejich brzda. Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě. Westcom 3D LAB demonstruje možnosti integrace bezpečnostních řešení více dodavatelů. Velké jazykové modely by mohly samy pro sebe generovat programy. A k čemu to může být dobré? Povede umělá inteligence k modernizaci finančních služeb?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 33/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Open source platforma Home Assistant (Demo, GitHub, Wikipedie) pro monitorování a řízení inteligentní domácnosti byla vydána ve verzi 2024.9.
articles.title: Home Assistant 2024.9

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: České bezpečnostní instituce, jmenovitě Vojenské zpravodajství (VZ) a Bezpečnostní informační služba (BIS), ve spolupráci s americkou Agenturou pro kybernetickou a infrastrukturní bezpečnost (CISA), Federálním úřadem pro vyšetřování (FBI), Národní bezpečností agenturou (NSA) a dalšími mezinárodními partnery ze Spojeného království, Austrálie, Kanady, Německa, Nizozemska, Estonska, Ukrajiny a Lotyšska vydaly upozornění (en, pdf), jež se týká kybernetických operací aktéra spojeného s ruskou Hlavní správou rozvědky (GRU), konkrétně 161. Specializovaného školicího střediska (Jednotka 29155). Jednotka 29155 je přinejmenším od roku 2020 zodpovědná za operace v počítačových sítích proti globálním cílům za účelem špionáže, sabotáže a poškození reputace.
articles.title: Upozornění na škodlivé aktivity ruského státního aktéra útočícího na kritickou infrastrukturu

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána (𝕏) srpnová aktualizace aneb nová verze 1.93 editoru zdrojových kódů Visual Studio Code (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek i s náhledy a animovanými gify v poznámkách k vydání. Ve verzi 1.93 vyjde také VSCodium, tj. komunitní sestavení Visual Studia Code bez telemetrie a licenčních podmínek Microsoftu.
articles.title: Visual Studio Code a VSCodium 1.93

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Laravel stojící za stejnojmenným open source PHP frameworkem získala investici 57 milionů dolarů od společnosti Accel. Především na Laravel Cloud.
articles.title: Laravel získal investici 57 milionů dolarů od společnosti Accel

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 1.81.0 programovacího jazyka Rust (Wikipedie). Podrobnosti v poznámkách k vydání. Řešena je také zranitelnost CVE-2024-43402. Vyzkoušet Rust lze například na stránce Rust by Example.
articles.title: Rust 1.81.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vládní CERT vydal (𝕏) novou verzi nástroje maldump. Ten slouží k extrakci souborů z karantén různých antivirových programů. A to jak z živého systému, tak z obrazu disku.
articles.title: maldump 0.4.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Meeting ESP komunity - podzimní edice 2024 proběhne v pátek 18. října v Brně. V přípravě jsou přednášky od vývojářů z Espressifu, lokálních firem i zapálených nadšenců do ESP a také praktický workshop a ukázky nových čipů.
articles.title: Meeting ESP komunity - podzimní edice 2024

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Systém pro správu hlášení chyb Bugzilla byl podle plánu vydán v nových verzích 5.2, 4.4.14, 5.0.4.1, 5.3.3 a 5.9.1, kde 5.2 představuje novou stabilní řadu, 4.4.14 by měla být poslední ve staré řadě 4.4, jíž končí podpora na přelomu roku, 5.0.4.1 je udržovací opravné vydání staré řady 5.0, dosavadní stabilní řada 5.1 byla přejmenována na 5.3 (nyní 5.3.3) a konečně vývojová verze 5.9.1 směřuje k budoucímu velkému vydání Bugzilly 6.
articles.title: Bugzilla 5.2 a aktualizace dalších řad vydání

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Správce sbírek Tellico (Wikipedie) byl vydán v nové major verzi 4.0. Přináší podporu Qt 6 a KDE Frameworks 6.
articles.title: Tellico 4.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V sobotu 7. září lze navštívit Maker Faire Pardubice, festival plný workshopů, interaktivních činností a především nadšených a zvídavých lidí.
articles.title: Maker Faire Pardubice

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel has submitted more kernel graphics driver changes for the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle. Following the pull requests to DRM-Next last week to enable Lunar Lake Xe2 graphics and Battlemage by default, some more lingering feature patches were merged today. Most exciting with this last round of patches before Linux 6.12? Intel graphics card fan speed reporting is finally wired up for their Linux driver...
articles.title: Intel Graphics Driver With Linux 6.12 Will Finally Report Fan Speeds

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the security changes with AMD Zen 5 processors that I haven't seen AMD publicly mention at least not prominently is that the new cores are not vulnerable to Speculative Return Stack Overflow (SRSO). Unlike Zen 4 and prior, under Linux I noticed that Zen 5 is no longer affected by the SRSO "INCEPTION" vulnerability. But of course there does remain other CPU security mitigations in place carried over from Zen 4. For those wondering about the mitigation costs or if it's worthwhile running Zen 5 with the "mitigations=off" insane mode, here are some benchmarks.
articles.title: AMD Zen 5 Not Affected By Inception/SRSO, mitigations=off Yields No Benefit On Ryzen 9000 Series

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2022 were a set of patches that allowed compiling the ARM64 Linux kernel from Apple macOS hosts. The intent was for developers just wanting to do some build/smoke testing from under an Apple Silicon device running macOS to see at least any kernel changes are successfully compiling on macOS with its LLVM/Clang-based toolchain. An updated form of those patches were posted today for review...
articles.title: Updated Patches Allow Compiling The Linux Kernel From Within macOS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With this week's announcement of the Intel Core Ultra 200V Series "Lunar Lake" processors, I've been very eager to try out the Meteor Lake successor for Linux testing. As sadly is usually the case, for delivering Linux support details and performance benchmarks around launch-time I'm typically left buying a laptop retail for Linux testing. In this case after seeing the Lunar Lake laptops announced this week and their availability, I ended up settling on the ASUS Zenbook S 14 (UX5406SA-S14.U71TB) for the initial Core Ultra 200V series Linux review...
articles.title: Pre-Ordered The ASUS Zenbook S 14 For Intel Core Ultra "Lunar Lake" Linux Testing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: We're very close to the finish line for the mainline Linux kernel being able to enable real-time "PREEMPT_RT" kernel support...
articles.title: Linux Very Close To Enabling Real-Time "PREEMPT_RT" Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Sent out today were the DRM fixes for 6.11-rc7 ahead of the Linux 6.11-rc7 kernel being released on Sunday. As usual most of the changes revolve around the AMDGPU and Intel i915/Xe drivers plus random fixes to the smaller drivers. There is one change though with the AMD Radeon graphics driver side worth highlighting to address a performance regression affecting recent kernels...
articles.title: Linux 6.11-rc7 To Fix A "Massive Performance Regression" For AMD Graphics

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's taken until now to add FreeBSD to the X.Org Continuous Integration (CI) automated testing so that all proposed changes to the X.Org Server can now be build-tested on FreeBSD rather than just Linux...
articles.title: It's Taken Until 2024 To Add FreeBSD To X.Org Continuous Integration Testing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: FEX 2409 has been released for this open-source project that's known for allowing x86_64 Linux binaries -- including both games and applications -- to run rather well on AArch64. It's also been working on enabling x86_64 programs on RISC-V but there due to architectural differences it's more of a challenge than with ARM...
articles.title: FEX 2409 Highlights Some Of The Challenges Of Emulating x86 On RISC-V

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2018 Oracle introduced Libresource as a standardized API for accessing system resource information around memory / network / device statistics and other metrics. Libresource v2 was announced this week as largely a rewrite of the project...
articles.title: Oracle Rewrites Libresource For Standardized API Of Linux System Resource Information

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the recently covered patches on Phoronix that enabled Intel Xe2 graphics out-of-the-box / by-default for Lunar Lake and Battlemage with the Mesa 24.3-devel Git code, Mesa 24.2.2 is out today in stable form that back-ports these Xe2 support changes...
articles.title: Mesa 24.2.2 Enables Intel Lunar Lake & Battlemage Xe2 Graphics Out-Of-The-Box

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: KDE e.V. announced the availability today of their annual report for covering 2023. While they made a lot of accomplishments and worked a lot on KDE Plasma 6 development, it was another year they unfortunately operated in the red funding wise...
articles.title: KDE Again Operated At A Loss During 2023

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Continuing on with the AmpereOne performance benchmarking while having the AmpereOne A192-32X in the lab within a Supermicro ARS-211M-NR R13SPD server, the next set of benchmarks is looking at the performance when using the near-final Linux 6.11 kernel. Additionally, quantifying the performance impact of using the ARM64 64K page size kernel as an alternative to the default 4K page size.
articles.title: AmpereOne Performance On Linux 6.11 Kernel, 4K vs. 64K Page Size Comparison

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last year to much excitement in our community was the new AMD project announcement of openSIL as an open-source CPU silicon initialization project that is an advancement for open-source firmware and to eventually replace AMD's AGESA across both client and server processors. This week an exciting new update on AMD OpenSIL was shared and that they are still on-track for having it production-ready next year...
articles.title: AMD Reveals Latest Plans For Open-Source openSIL With Replacing AGESA, Zen 6 Milestone

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Ah the memories of old AGP graphics cards... But it's largely just that these days: distant memories. For anyone by chance still running an Accelerated Graphics Port (AGP) graphics card in production, FreeBSD is looking at deprecating its generic AGP driver and then potentially removing it in FreeBSD 15.0...
articles.title: FreeBSD 15 Might Drop Its AGP Driver For Old Graphics Cards

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The first alpha release of OpenSSL 3.4 is now available for testing as the next feature update to this widely-used SSL library / cryptography toolkit...
articles.title: OpenSSL 3.4 Alpha 1 Released With New Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Linux 6.12 the Lunar Lake and Battlemage graphics are being enabled by default for out-of-the-box support with Intel's next-gen Xe2 graphics. Over in user-space the Intel OpenGL and Vulkan driver code has also begun enabling Xe2 graphics by default for use when running on Linux 6.12+. In Mesa besides no longer being hidden by the force probe option, a warning is now removed so users aren't told about unsupported Vulkan support when using Xe2 hardware...
articles.title: Intel's Open-Source Vulkan Driver Will No Longer Warn Over Using Xe2 Graphics

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linux 6.11 merged getrandom() in the vDSO Support for very fast yet secure user-space random number generation needs. That work was initially focused on x86_64 but beginning with Linux 6.12 and following on this getrandom() vDSO implementation will see expanded CPU architecture support...
articles.title: getrandom() vDSO Coming To More Architectures With Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Succeeding OpenZFS 2.2.5 from early August is now OpenZFS 2.2.6 that brings various fixes plus newer Linux kernel compatibility...
articles.title: OpenZFS 2.2.6 Debuts With Linux 6.10 Support & Early Linux 6.11 Compatibility

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: QEMU 9.1 is out in stable form today as the newest feature release to this open-source processor emulator that plays a vital role within the free software Linux virtualization stack...

articles.description: When it comes to the Rust programming language support within the Linux kernel one of the limitations is that the CPU architecture support isn't as widespread. Currently Rust for Linux supports x86_64, AArch64 (ARM64) little-endian, LoongArch, and RISC-V. While those cover the main targets, POWER is notably missing and many other niche CPU architectures supported by the Linux kernel especially for aging platforms. Patches posted today to the Linux kernel mailing list would extend the Rust support to MIPS...

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
The newest season of Fortnite changed up the locations of all the Shadow Briefings, which have become a crucial part of the shooter. You're able to take on challenges to earn bonus XP and rewards for completing the Shadow Briefing mission in time. Here's where you can find all of the Fortnite Shadow Briefing Locations in Chapter 5 Season 4.





Shadow Briefing Locations in Chapter 5 Season 4


In Chapter 5 Season 4, there are 26 total Shadow Briefing spawn locations in Fortnite. It's important to keep in mind that the Shadow Briefing terminal won't spawn at all of these locations each match. Instead, a handful of these locations, typically about 10, will spawn the Shadow Briefing terminals, in a rotation that randomizes each time. It's typically helpful to keep the map up so each match you can look in nearby areas until you learn where they can all spawn. Here are all the Fortnite Shadow Briefing Locations in Chapter 5 Season 4:



Northeast of Rebel's Roost


Catcher's Cove


Doom's Courtyard


Latverian Station


Castle Doom


The Ol' Mill


Doomstadt


Grim Gate


North of Charon's Crossing


Restored REels


Reckless Railways


Grand Glacier


Dumpenhausen


The Raft


Southeast of The Raft


Coastal Columns


Ship It! Station


Sandy Strip


Nitrodome


The Wreckmill


Pantheon Path


Southwest of Pantheon Path


Brawler's Battleground


Research Rock



You can also check the map above to see all the locations as is indicated by the yellow X's. There are several quests tied to the locations of the Shadow Briefings, so make sure you do them before the locations once again change with the start of the new season. They are typically scattered across the map, so usually, you can find one in close proximity regardless of where you drop, but because of the randomization that's never guaranteed.

The post All Fortnite Shadow Briefing Locations in Chapter 5 Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: All Fortnite Shadow Briefing Locations in Chapter 5 Season 4

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
If you enjoy playing Wuthering Waves and happen to have Discord installed on your PC, which I’d guess most of you do, then you might want to take advantage of this quest. 


Between now and September 9, Discord and Kuro Game Studio are giving 300,000 players the opportunity to get their hands on in-game items, including a Morphable Echo, simply for streaming themselves playing Wuthering Waves for a relatively short 15 minutes. 


As well as the Morphable Echo, which will provide you with echoes in-game when used, but also the following valuable resources to spend or use in Wuthering Waves as you see fit:



15,000 Shell Credits


2 Advanced Resonance Potions


2 Advanced Energy Cores



It doesn’t matter where you stream the game in Discord -- you can choose to share your gameplay with an entire server or simply just one friend -- but you should open and load the game before accepting the quest in the client. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


Once you’ve streamed for 15 minutes, you’ll receive a redemption code, which you can find by heading to the Discover page (right at the bottom of your list of servers by default) and then selecting ‘Quests’. Select which server you play Wuthering Waves on, and then follow the following steps in-game to claim your rewards:


Settings > Other > Redemption Code


Once you’ve entered the code, your rewards will be sent via in-game mail. Make sure to redeem your codes before the event ends on September 9, or you’ll lose out on the rewards!

The post PSA: Streaming Wuthering Waves over Discord gets you free Morphable Echo and more appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: PSA: Streaming Wuthering Waves over Discord gets you free Morphable Echo and more

articles.description:
Funko Fusion is set for release on September 13, and if you want to dive into the multi-franchise covering, full-chaos world of Funko Pops, then you’ll first need to know if your computer can handle the load. 


If you’re planning to play on console, then you needn’t worry about the specifications set out below. However, if you’re going to be purchasing and playing through Steam, then here’s everything you need to know about both the minimum and recommended requirements for PC.


PC requirements for Funko Fusion


Image via 1010 Games


Minimum:


Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit


Processor: Intel Core i7-4790K / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X


Memory: 8 GB RAM


Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti / AMD Radeon RX 470


Storage: 40 GB available space


Recommended:


Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit


Processor: Intel Core i7-9700K / AMD Ryzen 5 5600


Memory: 16 GB RAM


Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 / AMD Radeon RX 6600 XT


Storage: 40 GB available space


If you want the smoothest gaming experience possible, it’s recommended that Funko Fusion be installed on an SSD. Outside of this, as long as you meet the requirements above, you’ll have no problems exploring the Funko world, unlocking new characters to play, and getting the crown back to take down Eddy.

The post Funko Fusion: Minimum and recommended PC requirements appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Funko Fusion: Minimum and recommended PC requirements

The Hidden Gems agenda has 16 separate tasks. Each task has the same reward - one Hidden Gems pack.

Win 30 Breakout Full Lineup Games

Win 5 Showdown Games

The Hidden Gems agenda pretty much requires you to play every mode available in NBA 2K25 MyTeam. Some of the tasks can take a bit of time to complete, so you should start by completing the first objective of each type. At the start of your journey, you'll want to open as many packs as possible.

articles.author: Sourav Banik
articles.description:
Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is finally out, so fans can now delve into the magical Hogwarts pastime. But, for those with friends and accounts scattered across platforms, does it have cross-play and cross-progression support?


Quidditch Champions is the latest multiplayer game made by Unbroken Studios, featuring the iconic sport and characters from the Harry Potter movies. Multiplayer games like this are best enjoyed when cross-play and cross-progression work seamlessly among all the platforms they're available on.


Image via WB Games


Does Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions have cross-play?


Yes, Quidditch Champions has full cross-play support among all of its available platforms.


So, if you're playing on PC while your friends are either on a PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, or Nintendo Switch, you guys can queue up and play PvP matches together.


Does Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions have cross-progression?


Yes, Quidditch Champions also supports cross-progression. The studio confirmed this in their FAQ as well. You have to be connected to the same WB Account though, or else the progress won't sync.


I have the game on Steam and have been playing on my PS5 at the same time, thanks to PS Plus, and my progress is easily shared between the two platforms. So, that's a boon for players who have multiple copies of the game and want to continue from where they left off without breaking a sweat.


Now that you know about the game's features, be sure to link Quidditch Champions and Fan Club accounts to unlock exclusive in-game rewards.

The post Does Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions have cross-play and cross-progression? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Does Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions have cross-play and cross-progression?

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Remember Night Slashers? The 1993 arcade beat-’em-up by Data East? Do you remember that it’s getting a remake? Well, that’s out on September 26.


If you haven’t played it, Night Slashers is a solid beat-’em-up. It has the melty, goopy gore of Splatterhouse and the combat of… Um, I was going to say Final Fight, but it’s a lot looser than that. The Konami X-Men arcade game, maybe. It’s a nice mashy time. It was also available digitally last year from Johnny Turbo’s Arcade, but it got delisted.




I hope this remake isn’t the reason. I don’t mean to be dismissive – it has a decent art style, and it adds some additional features – but part of Night Slashers’ appeal was its pixel art style. It was a good-looking game for the time, and its graphics hold up. As much as the modernized art looks fine, it still takes away from the original.


On the other hand, it now supports four players instead of just three. This is enabled by a new character lifted from 1993’s Fighter's History, Liu Feilin. She’s cool, but kind of a disappointing pick. Hong Hua Zhao is already a female Chinese martial artist. So, now we have a cyborg dude, a waiter, and two female Chinese martial artists. I’m sure they control differently and have their own strengths, but diversity, please.


On top of that are some custom modes and modifiers that you can wrap into the experience. The original is a solid game, and the remake looks competently done. It’s $9.99 USD, which seems more than reasonable. Just hard to get excited about.


Night Slashers: Remake is coming to Switch, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and PC September 26, 2024.

The post That Night Slashers Remake launches this month if you’re into that sort of thing appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: That Night Slashers Remake launches this month if you’re into that sort of thing

If you’ve made waves with a bachelor or bachelorette in Stardew Valley and want to move your relationship on to the next level by getting hitched and having them live with you on the farm, you’re going to need a Mermaid’s Pendant. Here’s how to get one. 


The Mermaid’s Pendant is, for all intents and purposes, an engagement ring in the style of Stardew Valley. To get a potential beau to go on a date with you, you give them a Bouquet. To get someone to marry you, you give them a Mermaid’s Pendant. 


Before you can give anyone a Mermaid’s Pendant, you’ll need to do a couple of things:

Purchase and complete the first Farmhouse upgrade



How to get a Mermaid’s Pendant in Stard…

articles.description:
As you progress through the ranks of The Severed Threads storyline tied to Azj-Kahet in WoW: The War Within, you'll eventually receive the opportunity to make a pact with one of the three sub-factions that make it whole. 


If you're not sure which one to join up with, here's some information to help you decide which sub-faction to make a pact with in The War Within. 


Should you join the Weaver, Vizier, or General in WoW: The War Within?


To be upfront first, regardless if you decide to join the Weaver, General, or Vizier, the choice is not permanent. Based on how it is presented to you, you may be inclined to believe it is a one-time thing, but that is not the case. You need to make this choice weekly as it is the primary means of progressing the three sub-factions of The Severed Threa…

Fish ‘n’ Chips is a four-star meal, so you’ll need four ingredients to make it. While you only have to cook the fish and the chip parts of this meal, the dished-up plate also comes with mushy peas, tartar sauce, and a few slices of lemon, as all good Fish 'n' Chips should. 


How to make Fish ‘n’ Chips in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Like I said, you’ll need four ingredients to make Fish ‘n’ Chips:

articles.title: How to make Fish ‘n’ Chips in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Darrus Myles
articles.description:
In WoW: The War Within, the easiest way to make the best items in the game is to use Concentration to do it. However, this newly added crafting resource is very limited in how much you can use, so the question becomes: how do you get more of it?


How to recharge Concentration in WoW: The War Within


Concentration was added to The War Within as a replacement for the RNG mechanic tied to improving profession-related crafts in Dragonflight. The total profession overhaul that came with Dragonflight shaped the current system we have now, with Concentration being the most notable improvement to it.


So, how do you get more Concentration? The truth is that there is no known method for getting more Concentration by your efforts. Concentration is finite as a resource but recharges over time on its own. There's no way to speed this up, thus limiting the value and rarity of high-budget items a crafter can make at any given time. While this may be disappointing to read, there are benefits to it overall from a community perspective.


Screenshot by Destructoid


As just mentioned, no single crafter can always make the best items (at least not easily), which results in professions staying relevant significantly longer throughout the lifespan of an expansion. Dragonflight succeeded in doing this with its RNG-based system, but crafting items never felt great entirely dictated by how lucky you are. This is why the Concentration System was introduced.


Concentration gives you, the crafter, more control over your actual crafts. You can determine when you want to throw all your efforts into an important craft without wasting time or resources. Since using the mechanic guarantees you the next rarity of a chosen item, you will always know what your output will be the moment you hit that 'craft' button.  

The post How to get more Concentration in WoW: The War Within appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get more Concentration in WoW: The War Within

articles.author: Randy Marr
articles.description:
While there's no new base playable races or classes in The War Within, there is an unlockable race you can add to your roster. Sure, the Earthen aren't new to World of Warcraft. However, this particular kind we find have been hidden away from the rest of the world for a few millennia. Now they're ready to join the ranks of both the Horde and Alliance, and this guide will show you how.


What are the requirements for unlocking The Earthen Allied Race?


The key requirement for this new group of playable characters involves a heavy investment into The War Within's story. There are four specific elements that needed to get an achievement called "Allied Races: Earthen." Once you have that achievement, the new race is yours.


These achievement elements are going to be the main story campaign, …
articles.title: How to unlock the Earthen Allied Race in World of Warcraft

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Danish police have arrested a 39-year-old man who shared nude scenes of more than a hundred female actors through Reddit and porn sites. The suspect has been charged with copyright infringement. While posting small clips from movies or TV-shows typically doesn't result in criminal action, taking nude clips out of context is considered a breach of actors' and filmmakers' integrity.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Man Arrested for Sharing Copyright Infringing Nude Scenes Through Reddit

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Second Circuit Court of Appeals has dealt a blow to the Internet Archive's digital book lending program. The court upheld a lower court's decision, stating that IA's practice of scanning and lending copyrighted books without permission is not fair use. IA's lending program directly threatens the revenues of publishers and violates copyright law, the judges ruled.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Internet Archive Loses Landmark E-Book Lending Copyright Appeal Against Publishers

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Major sports rightsholders and broadcasters in Canada have selected UK-based site-blocking veterans Friend MTS to carry out all pirate IPTV blocking under a Federal Court injunction obtained during the summer. The fact that NHL, NBA, and Premier League streams will be blocked by major Canadian ISPs was widely reported. Yet, with significantly less fanfare, it appears that the UFC and MLB have also entered the blocking arena.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UFC & MLB Join Pirate IPTV Blocking as Broadcasters Collaborate to Cut Costs

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
This weekend, popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy went 'offline' displaying an image that some interpreted as a farewell message. Today the site returned and uploads at third-party sites resumed simultaneously. This is the second time in a few weeks that the site has gone through this mysterious cycle. The main question that remains: Why?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy is Back Online & Uploads Resume

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After obtaining an injunction and an invasive search and seizure order at Canada's Federal Court, teams from Bell, Rogers, Disney, Paramount, Columbia, and Warner Bros. targeted the alleged operators of IPTV service SmoothStreams at their homes in Canada. The defendants were charged with contempt of court when they failed to comply with the terms of the order. Two years later, the defendants are paying a heavy price and the main case hasn't even started.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bell, Rogers & MPA’s Pirate IPTV Lawsuit is a Slow-Motion Money Pit Nightmare

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Nhentai, a popular adult site with dozens of millions of monthly visits, has been sued for copyright infringement. The lawsuit was filed by California company PCR Distributing, which operates several hentai brands. The complaint alleges that nhentai doesn't respond to takedown notices. The site attempted to settle the dispute confidentially months ago, but that attempt failed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Pirate’ Site nHentai Sued in U.S. Court for Copyright Infringement

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A co-founder of a group, formed to raise awareness of "damaging" religious instruction received by schoolchildren in the U.S., now has support from the Electronic Frontier Foundation. After Zachary Parrish published the LifeWise Academy's children's curriculum on the website of 'Parents Against LifeWise' he was sued for copyright infringement. In support of a motion to dismiss, EFF says that copyright law isn't a tool to silence critics and a fair use defense will prevail.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: EFF Assists Critic’s Fair Use Defense Over Kids’ Religious Program ‘Leak’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cheat seller AimJunkies has suffered two new setbacks in its legal battle with 'Destiny 2' developer Bungie. The Seattle District Court refused to overturn a jury verdict issued in May and will not grant a new trial. Separately, the Court of Appeals affirmed a $4.3 million arbitration award, concluding that no clear errors were made and that the scale of the award is not “completely irrational”
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Court Denies Cheat Seller AimJunkies a New Trial, Affirms Bungie’s $4.3m Win

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Inside Out 2' tops the chart, followed by 'Borderlands'. 'Trap' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 09/02/2024

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The spectacular demise of Fmovies, Aniwave, and a dozen or more related big-brand pirate sites, has former users asking the same question: Are they really gone forever? With many resurrections and Dr. Who-like regenerations over recent years, some seem optimistic. Government records suggests that business bridges are being built from Hollywood to Vietnam, and back again. It seems unlikely that the resurrection of pirate sites would help in any way.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Fmovies & Aniwave: Will The Masters of Pirate Resurrection Rise Again?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy once again confuses users with a mysterious message. Instead of the usual list of downloads, it simply shows an image from the film Logan and the brief message "TG Forever". This is similar to a notice that appeared on the site a few weeks ago, after which it eventually resumed business as usual. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy Spooks Users with More ‘Downtime’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Earlier this month, U.S. law enforcement seized several domain names belonging to popular sports streaming site Streameast. However, instead of shutting down operations, the site is fighting back. After launching new backup domains, the site's operators inform TorrentFreak that they plan to challenge the seizure warrant in court.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sports Streaming Site Streameast Plans to Appeal U.S. Domain Name Seizures

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Despite malware having an even worse reputation than piracy, until now police operations to take sites down, explicitly because they're involved in both, have been pretty much non-existent. This week, music industry group IFPI revealed Operation Redirect, "the first operation of its kind in Brazil to target illegal sites associated with malware distribution." Intrigued by the announcement, we took a closer look and found plenty of drama.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Operation Redirect: Police Anti-Malware Action Protects Music & Pirates

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Fmovies, one of the most popular pirate streaming sites of recent times, disappeared a few weeks ago. No credit was taken by authorities or rightsholders, not even when related giants including AniWave fell this week. Today, initial suspicions are confirmed; anti-piracy group ACE says it assisted Vietnamese authorities to shut down the piracy ring. In parallel, the Vietnamese Government is organizing a promo tour in Hollywood.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Fmovies Piracy Ring Was Shut Down by Vietnam, Assisted By ACE

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A copyright lawsuit, filed in June by the world's largest educational publishers, accused Google of promoting pirate sites and profiting from piracy, among other things. This week Google responded to the Cengage Learning-led complaint with a motion to dismiss all but one of the publishers' claims, describing them as "tacked on" as part of a "kitchen-sink pleading strategy."
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Google Asks Court to Gut “Kitchen Sink” Lawsuit Claiming it Profits From Piracy

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Fmovies was once the world's most popular pirate streaming site. Then mid-June, after years of smooth sailing, it vanished into thin air. Sites with over a billion annual visits tend not to throw everything away so easily. Yet last night, a site with close to two billion visits disappeared in similar circumstances, rapidly followed by another, and then many others after that. In the absence of an official announcement, earlier today we took an early sift through the wreckage.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Sites, Billions of Visits, Wiped Out in Hours: Sifting the Fmovies Wreckage

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
After the recent shutdown of Fmovies, right now an entire streaming empire is collapsing. Big name casualties include Fboxz.to, Aniwave.to, Anix.to, AnimeSuge, Zoroxtv, the list goes on. In a message displayed on their homepages, visitors are advised to use legal options from now on. The exact same message appeared when 123movies threw in the towel a few years ago. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Streaming Giants Fboxz, AniWave, Zoroxtv & Others Dead in Major Collapse

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Claims that Italy will launch Piracy Shield 2.0 at the end of the year appear to be overly optimistic. With just four months left of 2024, a software supplier hasn't even been chosen yet. With the current system falling over, previously blocked domains and IP addresses are being unblocked to make room for new ones, something that the law has no provision for. Meanwhile, smart TV manufacturers will soon be asked to ban a VPN app from their sets.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Piracy Shield 2.0 in Doubt For 2024 , TV Manufacturers Urged to Ban VPN

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Do you know someone who sells dodgy streaming boxes or pirate IPTV streams? In Ireland, anti-piracy group FACT in partnership with Crimestoppers would like you to 'report' this activity. These 'snitch' initiatives are not widely embraced by the public but with a six-week social media push, the campaign aims to identity new enforcement targets.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pssst… Want to Snitch on Sellers of Pirate Streaming Services?
